ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Very informative and relaxed course. Glad I took it.
Assignments weren't very helpful in understanding the subject, and grading really wasn't feedback-oriented.
Great presenters
Very good course. The professor invited lots of speakers, which I think is very helpful and broaden my horizon.
I LOVED that this course was taught by several guest lecturers who were specialists in their field; this brought a lot of variety to lectures, and kept the interest high
The course was not interactive enough. It just consisted of listening to whoever the guest speakers were that week.

While I fully appreciate the epidemiology of cancer, I think that material could be much better taught, and helped to be retained. I appreciated the variety of guest lectures and the diversity, but some guest lecturers were definitely better than others. Reconciling the material as a student is quite difficult given the fact that we only have 3 assignments throughout the course of the semester. Some of the material itself is also quite repetitive from other epidemiology classes. I would prefer more epidemiology type assignments i.e. study design, etc. Dr Cartmel was also extremely vague about the final examination and what would show up on it.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Brenda is a great professor. She keeps things relaxed and knows her stuff.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  She was very nice, and cared about her students, but the grading was strange, and very difficult to predict how to do well.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Incredibly responsive to students
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Excellent.
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Very helpful and approachable
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Good, but could be a little more dynamic and interactive
Instructor: Brenda Cartmel  Brenda is a lovely lady, but it can be extremely difficult to listen to her for an hour mostly due to the volume and tone of her voice.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would highly recommend this course. Loved the format and liked giving the presentation.
Good intro to cancer epidemiology, but not without frustrations, including the assignments and the grading of them.
This class provided an overview of a wide range of cancer topics and was a good opportunity to hear from many researchers across campus
Very helpful course.
I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in learning more about cancer and cancer diagnostics
I would not recommend it because the material is repetitive and the class assignments are not always the most useful.
